content: And miles to go before I sleep.
author: Robert Frost

content: 人生如梦，一尊还酹江月
author: 苏轼

content: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind.
author: William Shakespeare

content: 黄河远上白云间，一片孤城万仞山
author: 王之涣

content: I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
author: W. B. Yeats

content: 众里寻他千百度，蓦然回首，那人却在灯火阑珊处
author: 辛弃疾

content: All that is gold does not glitter, not all those who wander are lost.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

content: She walks in beauty, like the night of cloudless climes and starry skies.
author: Lord Byron

content: 无边落木萧萧下，不尽长江滚滚来
author: 杜甫

content: I think that I shall never see a poem lovely as a tree.
author: Joyce Kilmer

content: 人生得意须尽欢，莫使金樽空对月
author: 李白

content: The soul selects her own society, then shuts the door.
author: Emily Dickinson

content: 问君能有几多愁，恰似一江春水向东流
author: 李煜

content: A thing of beauty is a joy forever.
author: John Keats

content: 千山鸟飞绝，万径人踪灭
author: 柳宗元

content: The child is father of the man.
author: William Wordsworth

content: 不识庐山真面目，只缘身在此山中
author: 苏轼

content: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
author: Walt Whitman

content: 行到水穷处，坐看云起时
author: 王维

content: To be, or not to be, that is the question.
author: William Shakespeare

content: 采菊东篱下，悠然见南山
author: 陶渊明

content: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul.
author: Emily Dickinson

content: 人生若只如初见，何事秋风悲画扇
author: 纳兰性德

content: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I— I took the one less traveled by.
author: Robert Frost

content: 山重水复疑无路，柳暗花明又一村
author: 陆游

content: Do not go gentle into that good night.
author: Dylan Thomas

content: 海内存知己，天涯若比邻
author: 王勃

content: I wandered lonely as a cloud.
author: William Wordsworth

content: 大漠孤烟直，长河落日圆
author: 王维

content: Because I could not stop for Death – He kindly stopped for me.
author: Emily Dickinson

content: 无可奈何花落去，似曾相识燕归来
author: 晏殊

content: Shall I compare thee to a summer’s day?
author: William Shakespeare

content: 天生我材必有用，千金散尽还复来
author: 李白

content: The woods are lovely, dark and deep, but I have promises to keep.
author: Robert Frost

content: 人生自是有情痴，此恨不关风与月
author: 欧阳修

content: I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart).
author: E. E. Cummings

content: 春眠不觉晓，处处闻啼鸟
author: 孟浩然

content: Let us go then, you and I, when the evening is spread out against the sky.
author: T. S. Eliot

content: 春潮带雨晚来急，野渡无人舟自横
author: 韦应物

content: O my Luve is like a red, red rose that’s newly sprung in June.
author: Robert Burns

content: 明月松间照，清泉石上流
author: 王维

content: I saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness.
author: Allen Ginsberg

content: 孤帆远影碧空尽，唯见长江天际流
author: 李白

content: The past is not dead. It is not even past.
author: William Faulkner

content: 月落乌啼霜满天，江枫渔火对愁眠
author: 张继

content: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.
author: Sylvia Plath

content: 绿蚁新醅酒，红泥小火炉
author: 白居易

content: I have measured out my life with coffee spoons.
author: T. S. Eliot

content: 忽如一夜春风来，千树万树梨花开
author: 岑参

content: I sing the body electric.
author: Walt Whitman

content: 谁言寸草心，报得三春晖
author: 孟郊

content: Love is not love which alters when it alteration finds.
author: William Shakespeare

content: 江南可采莲，莲叶何田田
author: 佚名

content: I am the master of my fate, I am the captain of my soul.
author: William Ernest Henley

content: 千里黄云白日曛，北风吹雁雪纷纷
author: 高适

content: The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a Heaven of Hell, a Hell of Heaven.
author: John Milton

content: 落红不是无情物，化作春泥更护花
author: 龚自珍

content: A poet is a nightingale who sits in darkness and sings to cheer its own solitude.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

content: 孤舟蓑笠翁，独钓寒江雪
author: 柳宗元

content: Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
author: Alexander Pope

content: 但愿人长久，千里共婵娟
author: 苏轼

content: The only emperor is the emperor of ice-cream.
author: Wallace Stevens

content: 春色满园关不住，一枝红杏出墙来
author: 叶绍翁

content: I dwell in possibility.
author: Emily Dickinson

content: 莫愁前路无知己，天下谁人不识君
author: 高适

content: The center cannot hold; mere anarchy is loosed upon the world.
author: W. B. Yeats

content: 夜月一川水，秋风万里衣
author: 杜甫

content: I have no riches but my thoughts. Yet these are wealth enough for me.
author: Sara Teasdale

content: 人生如逆旅，我亦是行人
author: 苏轼

content: The world is too much with us; late and soon.
author: William Wordsworth

content: 月黑雁飞高，单于夜遁逃
author: 卢纶

content: I am large, I contain multitudes.
author: Walt Whitman

content: 落霞与孤鹜齐飞，秋水共长天一色
author: 王勃

content: Love is anterior to life, posterior to death, initial of creation, and the exponent of breath.
author: Emily Dickinson

content: 无言独上西楼，月如钩
author: 李煜

content: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

content: 十年生死两茫茫，不思量，自难忘
author: 苏轼

content: I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.
author: Sarah Williams
